content.text:
# Wariapano language

| speakers         = moribund
| speakers2        = extinct 1991 (Pano)
| date             = 2013
}}
Wariapano (Huariapano), also known as Pano, Panavarro, and Pánobo, is a nearly extinct Panoan language of Peru. The last known speaker of the Pano dialect died in the spring of 1991.
There are three attested dialects: Shetebo and Piskino, which are no longer in daily use, and Pano itself, which is extinct.
